intro: Cyrtandra pololuensis, commonly known as the Pololu Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture and dark green color. Cyrtandra pololuensis is also notable for its role in supporting local pollinators and its ecological importance in Hawaiian ecosystems.
